title: Why do black people make good music? - Quora

response.answer_text: Music has always been inherently part of black culture. While other cultures keep it separated Or marginalized, it is more integrated in ours. When slaves were taken from Africa, they brought their rhythms and sounds with them and the music was a source of strength to help deal with the harsh life of slavery through Negro spirituals and became a fixture of the black church. Other forms developed to be the voices of the black experience including Jazz, Blues, Early rock, and R&B. For many, they opened doors to employment where barriers existed in other careers.
